pullRequest.body:
[Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/144837-PR-reviews/topic/feat.3A.20erw.3F.2C.20a.20tool.20to.20explain.20why.20erw.20is.20necessary.20.2321643)

Example usage: in 
```lean
def subalgebraMap (e : A ≃ₐ[R] B) (S : Subalgebra R A) : S ≃ₐ[R] S.map (e : A →ₐ[R] B) :=
  { e.toRingEquiv.subsemiringMap S.toSubsemiring with
    commutes' := fun r => by
      ext; dsimp only
      erw [RingEquiv.subsemiringMap_apply_coe]
      exact e.commutes _ }
```     
replace `erw` with `erw?`. You'll get the informational message:
```
(e.toRingEquiv.subsemiringMap S.toSubsemiring).toFun
  and
⇑(e.toRingEquiv.subsemiringMap S.toSubsemiring)
  are defeq at default transparency, but not at reducible transparency.
```
and this then suggests to a sufficiently expert reader which simp lemmas are missing! (In this particular case, I'd first replace the `dsimp only` with `dsimp`, and then run `erw?`, which tell you something more useful.)

Note that `erw?` only accepts a single lemma, so any `erw [X1, X2, X3]` need to be broken up first (this is probably good practice anyway, to record which steps really need the `erw`).

nodes.body:
### PR summary [7c5238274b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21643/commits/7c5238274b1c36ffff6779b8deaaad33211c3957)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
There are 4979 files with changed transitive imports taking up over 213465 characters: this is too many to display!
You can run `scripts/import_trans_difference.sh all` locally to see the whole output.

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ a`
`+ b`
`+ f`
`+ f_a`
`+ logDiffs`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>Increase in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (4.00, 0.00)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|1359|4|erw|

Current commit [7c5238274b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/7c5238274b1c36ffff6779b8deaaad33211c3957)
Reference commit [c335a815a0](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/c335a815a028dcf383a005e5d44e6662f2724623)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
I added an extremely primitive test (which indeed revealed problems in option handling!)

Thank you very much!

I just have one more suggestion.  How about accumulating the `verbose` messages and reporting them all together as a single message, using `cross/check-emoji`s to highlight non-reducible/reducible transparencies?

Here is what I have in mind:
```lean
/--
Check if two expressions are different at reducible transparency.
Attempt to log an info message for the first subexpressions which are different
(but agree at default transparency).

Also returns an array of messages for the `verbose` report.
-/
def logDiffs (tk : Syntax) (e₁ e₂ : Expr) : MetaM (Bool × Array MessageData) := do
  withOptions (fun opts => opts.setBool `pp.analyze true) do
  let verbose := (← getOptions).get `tactic.erw?.verbose (defVal := false)
  let mut verbMsgs := #[]
  if ← withReducible (isDefEq e₁ e₂) then
    if verbose then
      verbMsgs := verbMsgs.push
        m!"{e₁}\n  and\n{e₂}\n{checkEmoji} are defeq at reducible transparency."
    -- They agree at reducible transparency, we're done.
    return (false, verbMsgs)
  else
    if verbose then
      verbMsgs := verbMsgs.push
        m!"{e₁}\n  and\n{e₂}\n{crossEmoji} are not defeq at reducible transparency."
    if ← isDefEq e₁ e₂ then
      match e₁, e₂ with
      | Expr.app f₁ a₁, Expr.app f₂ a₂ =>
        let (newDiff, newMsgs) ← logDiffs tk a₁ a₂
        verbMsgs := verbMsgs ++ newMsgs
        if newDiff then
          return (true, verbMsgs)
        else
        let (newDiff, newMsgs) ← logDiffs tk f₁ f₂
        verbMsgs := verbMsgs ++ newMsgs
        if newDiff then
          return (true, verbMsgs)
        else
          logInfoAt tk m!"{e₁}\n  and\n{e₂}\n{crossEmoji} \
            are defeq at default transparency, but not at reducible transparency."
          return (true, verbMsgs)
      | Expr.const _ _, Expr.const _ _ =>
        logInfoAt tk m!"{e₁}\n  and\n{e₂}\n{crossEmoji} \
            are defeq at default transparency, but not at reducible transparency."
        return (true, verbMsgs)
      | _, _ =>
        if verbose then
          verbMsgs := verbMsgs.push
            m!"{e₁}\n  and\n{e₂}\n{crossEmoji} are not both applications."
        return (false, verbMsgs)
    else
      if verbose then
        verbMsgs := verbMsgs.push
          m!"{e₁}\n  and\n{e₂}\n{crossEmoji} are not defeq at default transparency."
      return (false, verbMsgs)

elab_rules : tactic
  | `(tactic| erw?%$tk [$r]) => withMainContext do
    let verbose := (← getOptions).get `tactic.erw?.verbose (defVal := false)
    let g ← getMainGoal
    evalTactic (← `(tactic| erw [$r]))
    let e := (← instantiateMVars (mkMVar g)).headBeta
    match e.getAppFnArgs with
    | (``Eq.mpr, #[_, _, e, _]) =>
      match e.getAppFnArgs with
      | (``id, #[ty, e]) =>
        match ty.eq? with
        | some (_, tgt, _) =>
          if verbose then logInfoAt tk m!"Expression appearing in target: {tgt}"
          match (← inferType e).eq? with
          | some (_, inferred, _) =>
            let (_, msgs) ← logDiffs tk tgt inferred
            if verbose then
              logInfoAt tk <| .joinSep (m!"Expression from `erw`: {inferred}" :: msgs.toList) "\n\n"
          | _ => logErrorAt tk "Unexpected term produced by `erw`, \
                  inferred type is not an equality."
        | _ => logErrorAt tk "Unexpected term produced by `erw`, type hint is not an equality."
      | _ => logErrorAt tk "Unexpected term produced by `erw`, not of the form: `Eq.mpr (id _) _`."
    | _ => logErrorAt tk "Unexpected term produced by `erw`, head is not an `Eq.mpr`."
```

and then updating the tests, possibly adding one that also tracks the `verbose` option.

I'll leave it up to you to make the choice for message reporting!

Since this is mostly a "diagnostic" tool, I think that it is good to make it available quickly and debug as issues get reported!  Thanks!

bors d+

:v: kim-em can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
Thanks, collecting the verbose messages is good. The cost is that the relatively short implementation code is now mostly obscured by the tracing code... Not sure I'm happy about that!
@adomani, I pushed some changes to your suggestion using a state transformer to collect the messages, and it's less intrusive now.
bors merge
bors r-
Canceled.
bors merge
bors r-
Canceled.

This looks good to me!

Would it make sense to have a test file for this, showing the various levels of `defeq` transparency?

This looks good to me!

Would it make sense to have a test file for this, showing the various levels of `defeq` transparency?

```
Looks like a stray comment.

    -- `e₁` and `e₂` are not defeq at reducible transparency
```
maybe?
Is this intended to be either a `trace` or something visible with a `verbose` flag?
Same here.

```suggestion
-/
```
This nesting would be lot clearer with `let $patt := _ | logErrorAt tk _`
Indeed, that is *way* better.

```suggestion
        (m!"Expression appearing in target:{indentD tgt}" ::
```

```suggestion
            logInfoAt tk m!"{crossEmoji} at default transparency,{indentD e₁}\n  and{indentD e₂}\nare defeq, \
```

pullRequest.title: feat: `erw?`, a tool to explain why `erw` is necessary
